description: Microbiology examines the morphology, composition, metabolism, and genetics of micro organisms with emphasis on bacteria and viruses. Students examine the dynamic impact of microbes on humans, the immune response, and the role of microbes in the environment. Students attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week. Offered annually. Prerequisites: BIO 143 or BIO 150, and one Chemistry course.
name: Microbiology
notes: Students in Bio 231 must also register for one lab Bio 231 AL or BL.
This course is open to a limited number of first-year students.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: BIO 143 or BIO 150, and one Chemistry course.
